title: Understanding Entropy Change
text: Entropy, a measure of disorder or randomness, often increases when a solid melts to liquid because the particles move more freely.

title: Energy and Heat Transfer
text: When ice melts, it absorbs heat from the water, leading to a more disordered system as the particles spread out.

title: Reabsorbing Heat and Entropy
text: Consider how the absorption of heat as ice melts affects the overall system entropy.
